one of the most buetful hotels in egypt

Under an Egyptian sun, you arrive at a gleaming golden tower on the banks of the Nile. Five-star luxury awaits. Your journey has brought you to Sofitel Cairo Nile El Gezirah.Entering a vast lobby with a dramatic spiral staircase, you immerse yourself in a world of grandeur that blends Arabic, Pharaonic and French Art Deco design.As the sun sets over this ancient land, the soft sounds of a flute catch your ear. Curiosity piqued, you venture out to find a procession in traditional dress bearing lanterns. Candles are lit. The ritual bids farewell to day and welcomes night. After an inspiring day of exploring lands where pharaohs walked, you seek respite. SoSpas Queen Cleopatra beauty ritual beckons. You ease into a soothing milk-and-almond bath strewn with rose petals, followed by an exfoliating scrub and relaxing massage

Bask in the elegance of Cairo Marriott Hotel and Omar Khayyam Casino. Guests are treated to lush gardens, a historic palatial property and 5-star accommodations. ur room service. Many of the rooms have balconies with views of the gardens, the city or the Nile. Upgrade to an Executive Level room to access the exclusive lounge and perks like free breakfast, afternoon tea and dessert. Our luxury suites feature generous layouts, kitchenettes and fireplaces. The property invites guests to use our gym, updated pool or brand new spa. Delicious dining options abound and include restaurants set amidst our verdant gardens. Those planning a wedding or conference in the Zamalek District will appreciate our hotels versatile and unique event venues. You can also enjoy an evening in our casino, or explore the nearby Cairo Tower, Cairo Opera House, Egyptian Museum, the Pyramids and the Sphinx

The Kempinski name is proudly . We believe life should be lived with style.

Gamal abd el naser museume is one of th e most butiful museume in Egypt it has alot of antiques in it an it is name is fore the president gamal abd el ansser

I am very glad to see the Coptic Museum entering a new era. The Museum itself has been under renovation for over five years. The historic buildings and the priceless artifacts housed in them have been painstakingly conserved, and the displays have been beautifully renewed.
As part of the rebirth of the Coptic Museum in the 21st century, it is only befitting to have a world-class home on the internet. This multimedia site offers a chance not only for leading scholars to share their expertise on Egypt’s Coptic heritage, but also an opportunity for members of the Coptic community to express their views and to contribute to the ongoing development of this vital part of Egypt’s culture and society.
I am proud of the many people who have worked so hard to make the Coptic Museum what it is today, and I am delighted to say that I feel this museum has a very bright future in the digital age. I hope that you enjoy this website.

Description Guests familiar with the flavours and spices of Lebanese cuisine will find them blended to perfection at Fayruz. for newcomers, let the famously friendly staff introduce you over lunch on the outdoor terrace or an exotic dinner show with live belly dancing. The interior is delightfully authentic and evocative.
